title: Cate Blanchett to receive Philanthropy Award at Harper's Bazaar awards
text:
Cate has worked as long-time advocate for women’s rights (Picture: Harper’s Bazaar/Tom Munro)

Cate Blanchett is set to receive the Philanthropy Award at the Harper’s Bazaar Women Of The Year Awards 2019.

The actress is to be awarded the accolade at the ceremony tonight (29 October), held in partnership with Armani Beauty, due to her work as a long-time advocate for women’s rights through movements such as Time’s Up and #MeToo.

Cate is also a Goodwill Ambassador for the United Nations High Commissioner For Refugees (UNHCR), a programme designed to protect refugees across the world.

And as she appears on the front cover of the December issue of Harper’s Bazaar, she has opened up on her work with the UNHCR and the UN Refugee Agency.

‘When I came onboard, there were about 61 million displaced people around the world, and now there are over 70 million – and that’s just in a handful of years,’ she explained.

‘The size and scale of the crisis is so overwhelming that it’s difficult to relate to.’

She also stressed that it has become ‘Groundhog Day’ for the women’s rights movement, stating that no real progress has been made.

‘We’re still talking about same-sex restrooms, we’re still talking about women in the military.

Cate appears on the front cover for the December issue of Harper’s Bazaar (Picture: Harper’s Bazaar/Tom Munro)

‘And how many years ago was that? It really has been Groundhog Day.’

The 50-year-old is currently filming for the upcoming drama miniseries Mrs America, in which she stars as Phyllis Schlafly, with the series concerning the true story of the movement to ratify the Equal Rights Amendment, guaranteeing equal rights regardless of sex.

Cate is to star in the upcoming drama miniseries Mrs America (Picture: Harper’s Bazaar/Tom Munro)

The series concerns the true story of the movement to ratify the Equal Rights Amendment, guaranteeing equal rights regardless of sex (Picture: Harper’s Bazaar/Tom Munro)

‘The difficulties faced by women on both sides of the political spectrum were identical,’ she said of her role in the series.

‘We’re always waving our flags of difference, but in the end, the result is to distance women from each other.’

Mrs America is set to premiere on FX in 2020. The December issue of Harper’s Bazaar is on sale from 30 October.
